item.title: HSUPA Joins HSDPA for Cellular Broadband
item.description: AT&T is nearing completion of its enhanced cellular broadband network, known as HSPA (High Speed Packet Access). This advancement is timely, as the latest BlackBerry Bold and the anticipated upgraded iPhone will utilize the increased data speeds now available. Although most attention has been on download enhancements, AT&T has also been quietly improving upload capabilities, hinting at the potential of upcoming mobile applications. HSPA is an upgrade within the complex world of mobile technology.

item.title: AT&T HSUPA Aircards Have the Edge Over EDGE
item.description: Major wireless carriers, including AT&T, are heavily invested in upgrading their cellular data capabilities to meet the increasing demand for broadband internet access. This demand stems from the desire for constant connectivity, enabling activities like web browsing and mobile video streaming. AT&T is eager to capitalize on this demand and provide the desired connectivity. Those accustomed to traditional wired broadband connections and basic cell phones may not fully grasp the advancements in mobile broadband technology.
